summary: This function transverses an iterable in order to find the minimum value therein.
returns: Return the minimum value found in the iterable.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Create some data.%0A    val ages = [19, 18, 20, 24, 25, 23, 21, 22];%0A%0A    # Compute the minimum, maximum, and average.%0A    val maximum = F::maximum(ages);%0A    val minimum = F::minimum(ages);%0A    val average = F::average(ages);%0A%0A    # Print the results.%0A    F::println(%22Maximum = %22 .. maximum);%0A    F::println(%22Minimum = %22 .. minimum);%0A    F::println(%22Average = %22 .. average.stripTrailingZeros());%0A}
